result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert W. Burghardt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert W. Burghardt

defendant.name: Burghardt, Robert W.
defendant.address: 3626 Seymour Rd Lot 27, Eau Claire, WI 54703

records.addlTxt: To defendant with copy of court appointed attorney bill and balance due.
Added attorney fees in amount of $221.00 due to Eau Claire County Clerk of Courts.
Attorney fees in the amount of $221.00 for Attorney Rivard. Includes 22CF175, 22CT56
Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant with DNA and Probation forms.

(11:38 AM cases 22CT56, 22CF175 called.) Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Robert W. Burghardt in court. Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Robert W. Burghardt.
Agreement has been reached and is recited by counsel.
Defendant pleads No Contest to 22CF175 Count 1: Possession of Methamphetamine.
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts the defendant's No Contest plea and finds the defendant Guilty of 22CF175 Count 1.

Court withholds sentence and places the defendant on probation for 2 years with the following conditions:
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. AODA and follow through with recommendations. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge and pay court costs. 4 days credit if probation revoked. 90 days jail with Huber privileges, stayed pending further order of the Court. Any remaining charges including case 22CT56 are dismissed and read in.

(Cases 22CT56, 22CF175 called at 2:03 PM) Defendant Robert W. Burghardt in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Robert W. Burghardt.  Attorney Monica A Fallon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver in 22CF175. Arraignment to be scheduled with Branch 5 Judicial Assistant.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Attorney Francis Rivard - at $100/hr.  Defendant shall reimburse Eau Claire County by making payments of $75.00 beginning 4/08/2022 and every 30 days thereafter.  Payment shall not exceed the full cost of representation.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on March 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

(Cases 22CF175, 22CT56 are called at 1:47 PM) Defendant Robert W. Burghardt appeared in court without counsel, Attorney Monica A Fallon appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is seeking counsel. Court advises Defendant of County Appointed Attorney process. Court advises the process of a preliminary hearing to the Defendant. State has no preference whether preliminary hearing is continued. Defendant is seeking counsel. Court finds good cause to extend the time limits. 
Preliminary Hearing: 03/22/2022 at 2:00 PM.

Conditions:
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services.
(Covers 22CF175 & 22CT56)
Preliminary hearing on March 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

(Cases 22CT56, 22CF175 are called at 11:37 AM- by Zoom) Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Robert W. Burghardt appeared by video, from the Eau Claire County Jail with Attorney Sonia Anderson. 
Defense acknowledges receipt of the complaints in 22CT56, 22CF175. 
Preliminary Hearing in 22CF175 & Hearing in 22CT56: 03/01/2022 at 2:00 PM.

Conditions:
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services.
(Covers 22CF175 & 22CT56)
